data_findings.finding: Santa 2025 is a 2D polygon packing problem: fit N Christmas trees (15-vertex polygons) into smallest square bounding box. Score = sum(side^2/n) for n=1-200. Target: 68.888293, current best ~70.65. Gap: ~1.76 points (2.5%).

Key optimization approaches: (1) Tessellation/lattice for large N (grid-based placement), (2) SA with fractional translation (0.001-0.00001 steps), (3) Backward propagation (remove trees from N to improve N-1), (4) bbox3.cpp optimizer with Complex Number Vector Coordination. Small N values (1-10) contribute most to score.

CRITICAL: Precision must be preserved in submissions. Converting float to string loses precision and causes near-overlaps to become actual overlaps. Keep original string values from source files. Kaggle uses stricter overlap validation than Shapely.
